trans-unit.target: Dapli infurmaziuns davart insert-tags pos ti chattar sut https://contao.org/manual/managing-content.html#insert-tags.

trans-unit.source: For more information about ACE please visit http://ace.ajax.org.
trans-unit.target: Visita http://ace.ajax.org per retschaiver dapli infurmaziuns davart ACE.

trans-unit.source:
Contao supports all date and time formats that can be parsed with the PHP date() function. However, to ensure that any input can be transformed into a UNIX timestamp, you can only use numeric date and time formats (j, d, m, n, y, Y, g, G, h, H, i, s) in the back end.

You can enter variant front end formats in the site structure (website root pages).

Here are some examples of valid date and time formats:
trans-unit.target:
Contao sustegna tut ils formats da datas e temps che pon vegnir elavurads da la funcziun date() da PHP. Per garantir che mintga endataziun po vegnir transfurmada en in timestamp da UNIX, pos ti tuttina mo tscherner formats numerics da data e temps (j, d, m, n, y, Y, g, G, h, H, i, s) en il back-end.

Ti pos endatar differents formats per il front-end en la structura da la pagina (paginas da ragisch da websites).

Qua èn exempels da formats valids da data e temp:
24 uras, minutas e secundas, p. ex. 20:36:59

trans-unit.source: 12 hours without leading zeros and minutes, e.g. 8:36
For more information about how to configure the syntax highlighter please visit http://alexgorbatchev.com.
trans-unit.target: Per uiteriuras infurmaziuns davart la configuraziun da la coluraziun da la sintaxa pos ti visitar http://alexgorbatchev.com.

trans-unit.source:
The HTML attribute sizes defines the displayed width of the image, optionally combined with a media query. You can use any CSS value to define the width.

E.g. (max-width: 600px) 100vw, 50vw means the images width is 100% of the viewport for small screens and 50% of the viewport for larger screens.

And (max-width: 600px) calc(100vw - 20px), 500px means the images width is 20px smaller than the viewport for small screens and 500px for larger screens.

For more information about the sizes attribute please visit w3.org.
trans-unit.target:
L'attribut da HTML sizes definescha la ladezza mussada dad in maletg, opziunalmain cumbinà cun in media-query. Ti pos utilisar mintga valur da CSS per definir la ladezza.

P.ex. (max-width: 600px) 100vw, 50vw manegia che la ladezza dal maletg è 100% dal viewport per visurs pitschens e 50% per visur pli gronds.

E (max-width: 600px) calc(100vw - 20px), 500px manegia che la ladezza dal maletg è 20px pli pitschen che il viewport per visurs pitschens e 500px per visurs pli gronds.

Per retschaiver dapli infurmaziuns davart l'attribut sizes pos ti visitar w3.org.

trans-unit.source:
If the sizes attribute is not defined, this setting simply defines the pixel densities you want to support. The dimensions of the images are adjusted automatically. E.g. 1x, 1.5x, 2x creates the following HTML code:
<img srcset="img-a.jpg 1x, img-b.jpg 1.5x, img-c.jpg 2x">

If the sizes attribute is defined, the same image sizes get generated but width descriptors are used for the srcset attribute. E.g. a 200 pixel wide image with the densities 1x, 1.5x, 2x creates the following HTML code:
<img srcset="img-a.jpg 200w, img-b.jpg 300w, img-c.jpg 400w">

For more information about the srcset attribute please visit w3.org.
trans-unit.target:
Sche l'attribut sizes n'è betg definì definescha questa opziun simplamain tge spesezzas da pixels che ti vuls sustegnair. Las dimensiuns dals maletgs vegnan adattadas automaticamain. P.ex. 1x, 1.5x, 2x creescha il suandant code da html: :
<img srcset="img-a.jpg 1x, img-b.jpg 1.5x, img-c.jpg 2x">

Sche l'attribut sizes è definì vegnan las medemas grondezzas da maletgs generadas, dentant vegnan descripturs da la ladezza utilisads per l'attribut srcset. P.ex. creescha in maletg da la ladezza 200 pixels cun las spesezzas 1x, 1.5x, 2x suandant code da HTML:
<img srcset="img-a.jpg 200w, img-b.jpg 300w, img-c.jpg 400w">

Per retschaiver dapli infurmaziuns davart l'attribut srcset pos ti visitar w3.org.
